meanings.definition: Move smoothly and quietly in a way that does not attract attention.
meanings.sent1: The cat will slink through the grass to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent2: She saw the spy slink around the corner, trying to remain unseen.
meanings.sent3: The ninja tried to slink past the guard, but he accidentally stepped on a squeaky toy.
meanings.sent4: The fog seemed to slink through the trees, enveloping everything in its misty embrace.
meanings.sent5: The ghostly figure appeared to slink along the hallway, disappearing into the shadows.

meanings.definition: To move in a sneaky or furtive manner.
meanings.sent1: The raccoon would slink around the campsite, looking for scraps of food.
meanings.sent2: The burglar tried to slink into the house without making a sound.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child would slink away with the last cookie when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The shadows seemed to slink along the walls, following her every move.
meanings.sent5: The spy would slink through the crowd, blending in seamlessly with the unsuspecting bystanders.

meanings.definition: To leave or go away without being noticed.
meanings.sent1: After the party, he would slink out the back door to avoid saying goodbye.
meanings.sent2: The shy student would slink away from the group when they started arguing.
meanings.sent3: The magician would slink off the stage, disappearing in a puff of smoke.
meanings.sent4: The sun would slowly slink below the horizon, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The thief would slink into the night, carrying his loot with him.
